AlanSantana;3-Jul;Bitcoin is likely to continue straight down...  This is another instance were no significant recovery is taking place.  The lack of volume on the bounce indicates that the bulls are not ready to play.  The way market psychology works is quite intriguing... We can guess how the market will behave by considering market psychology.  What are most people expecting?  What is the feeling/market sentiment right now? Are people in fear and panic?  Are people in greed?  Tops tend to be accompanied by euphoria
column2: excitement and greed.  Market bottoms tend to be accompanied by extreme fear and panic.  While Bitcoin produced a small drop
column3: there is no fear
column4: no surprise nothing.

column1: AlanSantana;3-Jul;"People are doing fine and this is good... It is good that people are healthy and strong. But
column2: for us market analysts
column3: this reveals that the correction might not be over after all. There are tens of thousands of new participants... No! Hundreds of thousands! Nay! Millions. Millions of people joined the Cryptocurrency market
column4: bought Bitcoin
column5: in the past 18 months.  These people had a nice ride and experienced a new all-time high but they have not experienced the other side. ust as we all went through a crash after seeing massive growth and expecting forever more when we started to trade
column6: something similar tends to happen to every new ""generation"" of traders/participants Ã‘that is what is most likely to happen next."

column1: TezosNetwork;11-Jul;"Why? Well there's a simple answer
column2: Bitcoin does not do what you expect. No cycle is the same
column3: the popular sentiment is always in the wrong. For instance
column4: in the previous cycle when Bitcoin bounced from 3-4k all the way to 13k
column5: the entire market was hinged on the idea that the uptrend was in full swing
column6: and that every consolidation is a buy and we were printing a bull-flag. Little did they expect
column7: Covid dropped the price right back to the 4k region
column8: though even without Covid that was still in the cards
column9: because Bitcoin does not behave.  So here's the idea
column10: this is the first cycle where the market sentiment is that pre-halving is accumulation
column11: and post-halving is when everything goes parabolic. But what if I told you that the parabolic phase would happen in the next few months leading up to the halving
column12: and that the halving would result in a year long consolidation to the downside bleeding out all the money that was thrown into the expectations of a ""bull run""?"

column1: TezosNetwork;12-Jun;Hello folks
column2: it's time for a new update
column3: but this time
column4: I'm brining in some macro analysis and a deep dive into the structure of Bitcoin.  Remember when I said nothing will happen until Summer/Mid-summer? Well
column5: looks like that came to be true
column6: Bitcoin did absolutely nothing and Altcoins bled for days.  Here's the thing
column7: after observing Bitcoin's movements the past few months
column8: I'm beginning to notice a few intricate details. Firstly
column9: I'm changing my idea of the post-summer capitulation
column10: into a possible post-summer rally! Why? Because of a few things
column11: Alts have been bleeding and we did not have a considerable Alt season
column12: Bitcoin is holding higher levels than expected
column13: and lastly the consolidation has been long and uneventful (usually a bullish sign).  So what do I think will happen now? Simple
column14: Bitcoin will consolidate sideways for a bit
column15: and we see some Alts rally first (particularly the older Alts)
column17: we may see Bitcoin breakout upwards around the end of summer
column18: and around the end of this year we'll get the biggest moves to the upside from retail. That's about it.

column1: TradingShot;28-Aug;Bitcoin (BTCUSD) is taking a hit on a weekly basis as
column2: despite last week's green candle that extended the rebound on the 1W MA50 (blue trend-line) and hyped hopes for a new 70k test

column17: we might be looking for at least a $150000 Target.
